bio:
I am an Assistant Professor (RTDa) at the University of Basilicata, Department of Mathematics, Informatics and Economics.

I was a Post Doc at the University of Padova working at two projects: 'Spatiotemporal and Stochastic Simulation Studies of Calcium Channels Effects in Endocrine Cell' and 'Next- generation modeling of wave and network properties in pancreatic islets' under the supervision of Prof. Morten Gram Pedersen, since March 2017.

I have completed my PhD in mathematics at the University of Torino in February 2017, under the supervision of Prof. Ezio Venturino.

I have completed my Master of Science in Mathematics at the University of Torino under the supervision of Prof. Elena Cordero (2013). Also I have complete my Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics at the University of Torino (2011).

My research area of interest includes: Electrical activity in endocrine cells; Eco-epidemiological mathematical models; Wastewater bioremediation; Mathematical modelling; Biological systems; Applied mathematics.
